[CLS] [SEP] kelly ##\ ##' ##s process of transformation began shortly after she arrived in prison following her conviction for murder in the death of her husband ##, doug gi ##ssen ##dan ##er ##. [CLS] [SEP] saturn ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 ##s rotation period - the time it takes to rotate once around its axis - has been notorious ##ly difficult to estimate in the past because of the planet ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 ##s unique properties ##. [CLS] [SEP] but using measurements of the ring ##ed planet ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 ##s gravitational field combined with its shape and density ##, scientists have determined a more exact value for a day on the planet ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists in israel have revealed a new estimated rotation speed for the ring ##ed planet ( ##sho ##wn ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] previously it was thought to rotate in 10 hours ##, 39 minutes and 22 seconds ##. [CLS] [SEP] but new figure of 10 hours ##, 32 minutes and 45 seconds is more accurate ##. [CLS] [SEP] this is based on measuring its gravitational field ##, shape and density . [CLS] [SEP] the research was carried out by scientists at tel aviv university in israel ##. [CLS] [SEP] radio measurements by the voyager spacecraft had estimated saturn ##' ##s day at 10 hours ##, 39 minutes and 22 ##. ##4 seconds in the 1980s ##. [CLS] [SEP] in 2006 ##, astronomers used more advanced equipment to measure the planet ##' ##s rotation ending up with a measurement of about 10 hours and 47 minutes ##. [CLS] [SEP] but an estimate that was 12 minutes shorter in 2009 only added to the confusion ##. [CLS] [SEP] mercury ##: 58 days and 15 hours . [CLS] [SEP] venus ##: 243 days . [CLS] [SEP] earth ##: 23 hours ##, 56 minutes ##, 4 seconds . [CLS] [SEP] mars ##: 24 hours ##, 39 minutes ##, 35 seconds . [CLS] [SEP] jupiter ##: 9 ##. ##9 hours . [CLS] [SEP] saturn ##: 10 hours ##, 32 minutes and 45 seconds . [CLS] [SEP] ur ##anus ##: 17 hours ##, 14 minutes and 24 seconds . [CLS] [SEP] neptune ##: 16 hours ##, 6 minutes and 36 seconds . [CLS] [SEP] the new method ##, though ##, provides what might be the most accurate reading so far ##. [CLS] [SEP] gas giants - such as saturn and jupiter - do not have solid objects on their surface that allow their rotation period to be observed ##, so other methods of finding this property must be found ##. [CLS] [SEP] the fit ##co ##in technology sync ##s with fitness tracker ##s to monitor how much energy is being used and this energy is converted into bit ##co ##ins ( ##pic ##ture ##d ##) ##. ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##it was created by chaotic moon studios ##, a technology studio in austin ##, texas and the designers recently demonstrated the app at this year ##' ##s s ##x ##sw festival . [CLS] [SEP] ' ##thi ##s concept combines two of our special ##ties ##: looking good and making money ##, ##' said chaotic moon boss ##, ben lam ##m ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##we ##' ##re always trying to turn existing habits into new opportunities to make money - this one was an obvious fit ##. ##' a bit ##co ##in is a piece of data locked in an internet ##- ##base ##d network by a complex equation computers can break ##. [CLS] [SEP] each bit ##co ##in is a piece of code that has been generated through computer processing ##, known as ' ##mini ##ng ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] once released it can be traded and used online and can be bought with cash ##. [CLS] [SEP] bit ##co ##in operates as a two ##- ##way currency which can be exchanged for dollars ##, and vice versa ##. [CLS] [SEP] the finite nature of bit ##co ##ins means it performs more like a commodity ##, such as gold ##. [CLS] [SEP] bit ##co ##in first emerged in 2008 and launched as a network in 2009 ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was created by a hacker whose identity is a mystery ##, but is known as sato ##shi nak ##amo ##to ##. [CLS] [SEP] this is thought to be a pseudonym for the person or group who created it ##. [CLS] [SEP] users choose a virtual wallet which enables them to receive ##, give and trade coins from other users ##. [CLS] [SEP] the app only works with fitness tracker ##s that monitor heart rate and have open source software ##, which includes the jaw ##bone up ##3 and mi ##o ##. [CLS] [SEP] as the

[CLS] [SEP] while bodies are most comfortable at around 50 percent humidity ##, an aero ##plane ##' ##s cabin humidity can be as low as 10 per cent ##. ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##tha ##t is dr ##ier than being in a desert ##. [CLS] [SEP] naturally ##, this extreme dry ##ness will only lead to only one inevitable conclusion ##: a very de ##hy ##dra ##ted traveller ##. [CLS] [SEP] according to nhs ##, the symptoms of de ##hy ##dra ##tion include ' ##di ##zziness or light ##- ##head ##ed ##ness ##, headache ##, tired ##ness ##, dry mouth ##, lips and eyes ##, and the passing of small amounts of urine in ##fr ##e ##quent ##ly ##. ##' de ##hy ##dra ##tion can also lead to a loss of strength and st ##amina and dry sin ##uses ##, nostrils and throat that make you far more prone to infection ##. [CLS] [SEP] combat all of this by drinking plenty of water and keeping away from beverages with di ##ure ##tic properties ##, like alcohol or coffee ##. [CLS] [SEP] low humidity in cabin air means that passengers should keep di ##ure ##tic beverages ##, like alcohol ##, to a minimum . [CLS] [SEP] ear pain . [CLS] [SEP] ever wondered exactly why you feel pain in your ears during takeoff and landing ##? [CLS] [SEP] it turns out that the uncomfortable feeling a product of the air on your ears expanding and causing increased pressure to build up within the ear canal ##. [CLS] [SEP] but it ##' ##s only when this pressure cannot be released ##, such as due to block ##age from a cold ##, for example ##, that the passenger will really be made aware of the change ##. [CLS] [SEP] luckily ##, all ##ev ##iating the pressure in most cases is relatively easy - simply by swallowing ##, chewing or ya ##wn ##ing ##. [CLS] [SEP] additionally ##, the motion sickness that you may feel in the pit of your stomach actually also starts in your inner ears ##, when your balance is thrown off by something like turbulence ##. [CLS] 64 ##, ##" ##most infections are caused by bacteria on the patient ##\ ##' ##s skin entering the surgical wound . [CLS] [SEP] scientists in the u ##. ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] have devised an implant in a tiny silk \ ##' ##pur ##se ##\ ##' that kills infections after surgery and then dissolve ##s in the body ##. [CLS] [SEP] up to four in 100 people undergoing surgery in the uk will develop an infection ##, and this can pro ##long hospital stays by as much as nine days ##. [CLS] [SEP] surgical wound infections are the leading cause of hospital read ##mission ##s after operations ##, according to a study published last month ##. [CLS] [SEP] most infections are caused by bacteria on the patient ##\ ##' ##s skin entering the surgical wound ##. [CLS] [SEP] the most common cu ##lp ##rit ##s are st ##ap ##hyl ##oco ##ccus au ##reus bacteria ##, responsible for 20 per cent of surgical site infections ##, coa ##gul ##ase negative st ##ap ##hyl ##oco ##ccus ##, and enter ##oco ##ccus bacteria ##. [CLS] [SEP] the infection can usually be treated with antibiotics but sometimes patients need more complex treatment ##, including further surgery ##. [CLS] [SEP] the new implant uses heat to kill off bacteria ##. [CLS] [SEP] it consists of a tiny ##, magnesium coil wrapped in a pocket of silk protein ##, and is implant ##ed during surgery - if the patient later shows sign of infection ##, the implant can be switched on using a remote control ##. [CLS] [SEP] this raises the temperature of the coil ##. [CLS] [SEP] the silk protein protects the coil - both harmless ##ly dissolve in the body over the next fort ##night ##. [CLS] [SEP] this is an improvement on previous medical implant devices ##, which are made from non ##- ##de ##grad ##able materials that need to be removed ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers at tufts university have used the implant in mice infected with st ##ap ##hyl ##oco ##ccus au ##reus ##, raising its temperature for two periods of ten minutes ##. [CLS] [SEP] within 24 hours the tissue was infection ##- ##free ##. [CLS] [SEP] the device ##, including the coil ##, completely dissolved after 15 days ##. [CLS] [SEP] \ ##' ##thi ##s is an important step forward for the development of on ##- ##de ##man ##d medical devices that can be turned on remotely ##, ##\ ##' the researchers said ##. [CLS] [SEP] \ ##' ##thes ##e wireless strategies could help manage post ##- ##sur ##gical infection ##, for example ##, or pa ##ve the way for eventual " ##" ##wi ##- ##fi ##" ##" drug delivery ##. ##\ ##' the team has also carried out experiments using remote control to deliver antibiotics to treat e ##. ##col ##i and st ##ap ##hyl ##oco ##ccus au ##reus ##. [CLS] 96 ##, ##" ##thi ##s winter has been the season that literally divided america into two ##. [CLS] [SEP] this stunning weather map shows ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##how those in the west of the country enjoyed one of the warm ##est february ##' ##s on record ##, while those in the east endured heavy snowfall and freezing temperatures ##. [CLS] [SEP] the extreme contrast in temperatures has been put down to global warming and the melting sea ice in the arctic by some experts ##, according to nasa ##' ##s earth observatory ##. [CLS] [SEP] the satellite image produced by nasa records the land surface temperature ##. [CLS] [SEP] the places that experience below average conditions are coloured blue ##, normal appear white and those in red were warmer than average . [CLS] [SEP] the map has been produced using data from nasa ##' ##s terra satellite and shows how temperatures this february compared with those over the last ten years ##. ##. [CLS] [SEP] the satellite recorded the land surface temperature and the map shows a clear divide right down the middle of the country ##. [CLS] [SEP] the areas that experienced cooler than average conditions are coloured in blue ##, normal appear white ##, and those in red were warmer than average ##. [CLS] [SEP] the mercury soared some 10 degrees approve than average in the western half and those in the east saw temperatures 10 degrees below average ##. [CLS] [SEP] statewide data showed that no state experienced record cold temperatures in february ##, but many cities broke their own records ##, according to live science ##. [CLS] [SEP] in new york a new low of minus 13 degrees was set ##, beating its old record by 1 ##. ##6 degrees ##. [CLS] [SEP] last month huge ice sheets formed on the surface of new york ##' ##s hudson river forcing the us coast ##guard to deploy ice breakers in order to keep shipping and ferry traffic moving ##. [CLS] [SEP] ferry operators in the city described it as the worst winter they had experienced in more than 28 years ##. [CLS] [SEP] a huge ice volcano also appeared in a new york park ##. [CLS] [SEP] records were also broken in the likes of worcester and ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##mas ##sa ##chus ##ett ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] in contrast record highs were set in the likes of washington ##, nevada ##, and california during february ##, according to the website ##. [CLS] [SEP] california is in the midst of a three year drought that has been caused by a combination of record high temperatures and sparse rainfall ##. [CLS] [SEP] this has produced the worst conditions in 1 ##, ##200 years ##, according to a study ##. [CLS] 116 ##, ##" ##ac ##cor ##ding to some accounts ##, the wealth of the ancient roman empire was reflected in the very fabric of the city - with buildings of sparkling white marble at its centre ##. [CLS] [SEP] even the founder of the roman empire ##, emperor augustus claimed that he had ' ##fo ##und rome a city of bricks and left it a city of marble ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] but new research by historians at the university of california los angeles has now cast doubt on this bo ##ast ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down to explore ancient rome in 3d . [CLS] [SEP] this reconstruction by historians at the university of california shows how rome would have looked under the rule of augustus and reveals that many of the buildings were made from brick ( ##sho ##wn in grey ##) while only a few temples were constructed from marble ( ##pin ##k ##) using architectural computer modelling software they have been able to rec ##ons ##truct the entire city to reveal how it would have looked during the rule of augustus between 44 ##bc and 14 ##ad ##. [CLS] [SEP] the pantheon ##, tr ##ajan ##' ##s market and the col ##oss ##eum have remained standing for nearly 2 ##, ##00 ##0 years ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists claim to have found a ' ##se ##cre ##t ##' ingredient in roman concrete that helped it endure the elements ##. [CLS] [SEP] using x ray beams at the advanced light source ( ##als ##) ##, researchers were able to study a reproduction of roman volcanic ash ##- ##lim ##e mortar ##. [CLS] [SEP] in the concrete walls of tr ##ajan ##' ##s markets ##, constructed around 110 ce ##, this mortar binds cobb ##le ##- ##si ##zed fragments of tu ##ff and brick ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists looked at the mineral ##ogical changes that took place in the cu ##ring of the mortar over a period of 180 days and compared the results to 1 ##, ##90 ##0 year old samples of the original ##. [CLS] [SEP] the team discovered that the volcanic ash creates a crystal structure that prevents tiny cracks from spreading ##. [CLS] [SEP] they also found that the use of st ##r ##\ ##x ##c ##3 ##\ ##xa ##4 ##tling ##ite crystals in the material showed no corrosion ##, with their smooth surface suggesting stability ##. [CLS] [SEP] they found that in fact only a small proportion of the buildings in rome at the time were converted from brick into marble ##. [CLS] [SEP] indeed ##, the few buildings that were built from marble were hidden from view within the city landscape ##, meaning many historical disc ##rip ##tions of the city ##' ##s beauty were perhaps exaggerated ##. [CLS] [SEP] their discovery suggests that the claim attributed to augustus may have been more of a metaphor than a literal bo ##ast ##. [CLS] [SEP] dr diana fa ##vr ##o ##, who led the

[CLS] [SEP] with no freedom of movement ##, much like the refugees themselves ##, ten hoop ##en resort ##ed to an old trick he had used before while traveling in africa ##. [CLS] [SEP] with the help of refugee hospital workers ##, he built a makeshift photo studio using hospital bed sheets and other materials available ##. [CLS] [SEP] the studio quickly became a sensation ##. [CLS] [SEP] once hospital employees volunteered to have their photo taken ##, lines of refugees began s ##na ##king around the hospital grounds waiting to have their portraits taken ##. [CLS] [SEP] one by one ##, these people sat solemnly to be photographed ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was their time to be acknowledged ##. [CLS] [SEP] there was gravity ##, earnest ##ness to the way they posed ##. [CLS] [SEP] this was the moment their story would be registered ##. [CLS] [SEP] " ##" ##thi ##s was one of the reasons why i built the studio ##: to get more material and more narratives from the people ##, ##" ##" ten hoop ##en said ##. [CLS] [SEP] the project quickly became a catalog of the history and identity of the refugees ##. [CLS] [SEP] the photos span several generations - ##- some of the subjects were born at the refugee camp ##, some have been there for decades ##. [CLS] [SEP] women wearing the traditional sudanese to ##be spell out their class and origin by the way it is wrapped ##. [CLS] [SEP] from the muslim north ##, women are fully covered - ##- a contrast to women from the christian south ##, who we also see represented in these photos ##. [CLS] [SEP] whether from sudan ##, south sudan or eritrea ##, the faces become ##, individually and collectively ##, a portrait of the endless wars that have shaped the horn of africa ##. [CLS] 176 ##, ##" ##one of australia ##' ##s most popular pain killers has been left with a splitting headache ##, as the national consumer watch ##dog gets ready to take it to court ##. [CLS] [SEP] rec ##kit ##t ben ##cki ##ser ##, the company behind nur ##of ##en in australia ##, will square off against the australian competition and consumer commission ( ##ac ##cc ##) in federal court this month over claims that it has mis ##lea ##d customers ##. [CLS] [SEP] the acc ##c will dispute claims made by the company that the nur ##of ##en specific pain range is specially designed to target different types of pain ##. [CLS] [SEP] the consumer watch ##dog claims that all products contain identical ingredients ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for video . [CLS] [SEP] australia ##' ##s consumer watch ##dog is taking nur ##of ##en to court over its advertising claiming its products target specific types of pain . [CLS] [SEP] the products in question are ##: nur ##of ##en back pain ##, nur ##of ##en period pain ##, nur ##of ##en mig ##raine pain and nur ##of ##en tension headache ##. [CLS] [SEP] acc ##c chairman rod sims said cracking down on false advertising surrounding medical products was a target ##ted priority for the watch ##dog ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##the acc ##c takes false or misleading claims about the efficacy of health and medical products very seriously ##, ##' mr sims said ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##in this case ##, we all ##ege that consumers have been mis ##led into purchasing nur ##of ##en specific pain products under the belief that each product is specifically designed for and effective in treating a particular type of pain ##, when this is not the case ##. ##' ' ##the acc ##c takes false or misleading claims about the efficacy of health and medical products very seriously ##, ##' chairman rod sims said ##. [CLS] [SEP] it also flag ##ged the ' ##si ##gni ##fi ##can ##tly ##' higher cost of nur ##of ##en compared to other products as a concern ##, with the range in question costing up to twice as much as a standard pain killer sold by nur ##of ##en or another comparable brand ##. [CLS] [SEP] a nur ##of ##en spoke ##sw ##oman denied the allegations in a statement ##, and said pain ##- ##sp ##ec ##ific products made life easier for customers ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##nu ##ro ##fen is committed to the quality use of medicines and promoting and protecting the health of australians ##, ##' the statement read ##. [CLS] 200 ##, ##" ##fi ##fa has confirmed the 202 ##2 world cup final in qatar will take place on sunday ##, december 18 ##. [CLS] [SEP] it comes after a fifa task ##force recommended last month the tournament should be switched from summer to winter to avoid the searing heat of the gulf in june and july ##, where temperatures can exceed 40 ##c ##. [CLS] [SEP] the decision to hold the first ever winter world cup was taken more than four years after the most controversial award of a sporting event in history ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for video . [CLS] [SEP] shock ##: fifa president sep ##p b ##lat ##ter awarded the 202 ##2 world cup to qatar in december 2 ##, 2010 . [CLS] [SEP] iron fist ##: sep ##p b ##lat ##ter ##, speaking to journalists today ##, confirmed the final will be on december 18 ##, 202 ##2 . [CLS] [SEP] confirming the date for the 202 ##2 world cup final ##, walter de gregor ##io ##, fifa ##' ##s director of communications ##, said ##: ' ##thi ##s is for us an important step ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##fin ##ally we know the end of the tournament ##. [CLS] [SEP] it ##' ##s a sunday and ##, by the way ##, it ##' ##s the national day in qatar ##, so it fits perfectly ##. ##' he added ##: ' ##you have enough time to do your christmas shopping ##. ##' fifa has indicated the 202 ##2 tournament will also be shortened to 28 days ##, instead of the usual 32 ##. [CLS] [SEP] the church ##, which accounts for just under two million members and represents the largest presbyterian denomination ##, made the announcement after the majority of its 171 regional governing bodies approved the change ##. [CLS] [SEP] its revised constitution will now read that marriage is ' ##a unique commitment between two people ##, traditionally a man and a woman ##, ##' as opposed to just a man and woman previously ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for video . [CLS] [SEP] the presbyterian church usa which accounts for just under two million members ##, voted to expand its definition of marriage to include gay and lesbian couples \ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##9 ##ale ##x wong ( ##get ##ty images ##/ ##af ##p ##/ ##fi ##le ##) ' ##fin ##ally ##, the church in its constitutional documents fully recognizes that the love of gay ##s and lesbian couples is worth celebrating in the faith community ##, ##' rev ##. [CLS] [SEP] brian d ##. [CLS] [SEP] ellison ##, executive director of the covenant network of presbyterian ##s ##, which advocates gay inclusion in the church ##, told the new york times ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##ther ##e is still disagreement ##, and i don ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 ##t mean to minimize that ##, but i think we are learning that we can disagree and still be church together ##. ##' the new language ##, which was approved by the church ##' ##s general assembly last year ##, had to be ratified by more than half its regional bodies ##. [CLS] [SEP] a grouping of congregations in the state of new jersey became the 86 ##th body to do just that tuesday ##. [CLS] [SEP] the decision is likely to drive a further wedge between presbyterian usa members ##, who have taken opposite sides on the issue ##. [CLS] [SEP] the church has in fact been losing some of its members as it adopt ##s a more liberal stance on social and religious issues ##. [CLS] [SEP] that being said ##, the fact that some many members who were against same ##- ##se ##x marriage have moved on to other churches made the passage of this new definition far easier for the church ##. [CLS] [SEP] at last year ##' ##s presbyterian general assembly ##, the church also gave its pastor ##s a green light to marry gay and lesbian couples in states where such marriages are allowed ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##thes ##e decisions have been welcomed by some and are a disappointment to others ##, ##' grady ##e parsons ##, stated clerk of the general assembly ##, said at the time ##. [CLS] [SEP] the presbyterian ##s ##' position stands in sharp contrast to that of the roman catholic church ##,

[CLS] 240 ##, ##" ##an estimated one in five people will suffer with depression in their lifetime ##. [CLS] [SEP] but scientists have now found that mac ##aq ##ue monkeys show similar signs of depression to humans ##, such as shy ##ing away from a group ##, losing their appetite and adopting a hunched posture ##. [CLS] [SEP] by studying creatures in a social situation ##, they hope to learn more about why humans may become depressed ##, which could improve treatment for the de ##bil ##itating mental disorder ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists have found that mac ##aq ##ue monkeys show similar signs of depression to humans ##, such as shy ##ing away from a group ( ##sho ##wn in e ##) and adopting a hunched posture ( ##sho ##wn at a ##, b ##, d and e ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] image c suggests bullying from dominant monkeys ( ##mark ##ed in the pictures with red arrows ##) in the form of a cut to the monkey ##' ##s ear ##. [CLS] [SEP] intimidating behaviour ( ##b and d ##) may explain the monkeys ##' depression . [CLS] [SEP] previous studies have used rodents ##, which ' ##do not realistic ##ally resemble the et ##io ##path ##ological [ ##ca ##usa ##l ##] development of depression ##, which occurs naturally in a social context ##, ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 according to the study ##, published in nature ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers at chong ##qing medical university ##, china ##, and wake forest university in north carolina ##, examined depression in cy ##no ##mo ##l ##gus mac ##aq ##ue monkeys living in social colonies at z ##hong ##ke experimental animal co ##. [CLS] [SEP] in su ##zhou ##, eastern china ##. [CLS] [SEP] the cause of depression in some cases ##, appears to be down to bullying behaviour by dominant members of the colonies ##, such as intimidating and even attacking lower status monkeys ##. [CLS] [SEP] each colony was made up of two males and approximately 20 females as well as their offspring ##, reflecting how they would live in the wild ##. [CLS] [SEP] twenty females showing symptoms of depression ##, such as no interest in food ##, groom ##ing or mating ##. [CLS] [SEP] dominant behaviour is marked with red arrows ##, above and depressed monkeys with blue arrows ##. [CLS] [SEP] feeding ##: the depressed monkeys spent less time eating and drinking than their healthy peers ##. [CLS] [SEP] behaviour ##: they spent less time resting on elevated perch ##es such as shelves and hanging chains ##, which are favourites with health ##ier and more dominant monkeys ##. [CLS] [SEP] movement ##: depressed subjects spent more time sitting on the floor and less time walking around ##. [CLS] [SEP] groom ##ing ##: the sad monkeys spent less time groom ##ing each other and being groom ##ed ##, which is a sign of soc ##ia ##bility in healthy monkeys ##. [CLS]

[CLS] [SEP] ' ##we did not worry about it ##, his doctor said it will fade as he gets older ##. ##' according to nhs choices ##, birth ##marks come in two main categories ##, vascular or pigment ##ed ##. [CLS] [SEP] vascular birth ##marks tend to occur in the head or neck area ##, being caused by abnormal blood vessels in or under the skin ##, which can fade after a few months ##. [CLS] [SEP] in comparison ##, pigment ##ed birth ##marks are tan or brown ##- ##col ##oured ##, caused by a cluster of pigment cells ##. [CLS] [SEP] most birth ##marks are harmless and don ##' ##t need to be treated ##. [SEP]

[CLS] 259 ##, ##" ##the eu is set to lift a ban on imports of chicken from the united states which are washed with a suspect acid di ##sin ##fect ##ant ##. [CLS] [SEP] the practice has been banned in britain and europe for many years because of a determination to remove harmful bugs at source ##, rather than using di ##sin ##fect ##ants to clean up car ##cas ##ses ##. [CLS] [SEP] there are also concerns that reliance on these wash ##es could put consumers at risk by playing a part in the creation of superb ##ug ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, the european commission has signal ##led that it plans to lift the ban following pressure from the american government and us chicken producers ##. [CLS] [SEP] the eu has lifted a ban on u ##. ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] chickens which are washed in an acid it is feared helps cause superb ##ug ##s . [CLS] [SEP] the proposal has alarmed consumer groups ##, who say it is at odds with european policy ##, which has been designed to remove harmful bacteria from the birds on farms ##, rather than relying on di ##sin ##fect ##ants ##. [CLS] [SEP] man ##' ##s best friend ##: an early cave painting in libya of dogs chasing a deer in the aka ##kus mountains ##. [CLS] [SEP] a new theory claims humans teamed up with the ancestors of domestic dogs far earlier than was first thought . [CLS] [SEP] left behind ##: while early humans hunted with wolves ##, their ne ##ander ##thal rivals in europe continued using primitive tools without any help ##, according to anthropologist dr pat ship ##man ( ##art ##ist ##' ##s impression ##) the controversial theory has been put forward in a new book by leading anthropologist pat ship ##man of ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##pen ##ns ##yl ##vani ##a state university ##. [CLS] [SEP] she has challenged the common scientific view that wolves were only domestic ##ated just over 10 ##, ##00 ##0 years ago ##, after early humans had already asserted a strong foot ##hold in europe ##. [CLS] [SEP] no match ##: the theory claims ne ##ander ##thal ##s ( ##mo ##del pictured ##) were no match for the hunting technique . [CLS] [SEP] instead ##, she said ##, humans began tam ##ing and breeding wolves - leading to the pets we know today - soon after they arrived on the continent from africa up to 70 ##, ##00 ##0 years ago ##. [CLS] [SEP] at the time ##, our close genetic relatives the ne ##ander ##thal ##s were dominant in europe ##, fighting for survival as they hunted creatures such as wool ##ly mammoth ##s with primitive tools ##. [CLS] [SEP] but soon afterwards the rival species died out ##, leaving a clear path for the homo sap ##iens that make up today ##' ##s humans ##. [CLS] [SEP] strong rival theories of their demise include that ne ##ander ##thal ##s ##, just like wool ##ly mammoth ##s ##, were unable to cope with the changing climate of the last ice age or that humans were better hunters ##. [CLS] [SEP] dr ship ##man ##, however ##, told the observer ##: ' ##we formed an alliance with the wolf and that would have been the end for the ne ##ander ##thal ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##ear ##ly wolf ##- ##dog ##s would have tracked and harassed animals like elk and bison and would have hound ##ed them until they tired ##. [CLS] 307 ##, ##" ##res ##ear ##chers studying nature have turned to a new frontier they say could be more diverse than an ##most anywhere else - homes ##. [CLS] [SEP] they say indoor spaces could be the fastest growing bio ##me ##, a word used to describe the different realms of life on ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##ear ##th ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers estimate that the indoor bio ##me makes up about 0 ##. ##5 percent of ice ##- ##free land ##, or about 247 ##, ##00 ##0 square miles ##, almost the size of texas ##. [CLS] [SEP] the various organisms living in homes and other indoor spaces rarely has been researched ##, with sparse studies of rodents and german cock ##ro ##ache ##s ##, researchers say ##. [CLS] [SEP] a study of 40 houses in north carolina used gen ##omic technologies to document the inhabitants ##. [CLS] [SEP] it found more than 8 ##, ##00 ##0 bacterial and arch ##aea ##l taxa ##. [CLS] [SEP] another study of 50 houses in the same state described more than 750 types of art ##hr ##op ##ods ##, including insects and spiders . [CLS] [SEP] an examination of 11 houses in california found a great variety of fungus among us ##. [CLS] [SEP] a review paper published march 19 in the journal trends in ecology and evolution serves as a call for research in the emerging field of indoor bio ##me ecology and evolution ##. [CLS] [SEP] the various organisms living in homes and other indoor spaces rarely has been researched ##, with sparse studies of rodents and german cock ##ro ##ache ##s ##, for example ##, from the pest management field ##, or public health perspectives on micro ##bes ##. [CLS] 43 ##1 ##, ##" ##a star that is travelling fast enough to escape the gravitational clutches of our galaxy has been discovered by a team of astronomers ##. [CLS] [SEP] the amazing stellar object attained its rapid speed when a nearby star exploded as a super ##nova ##, sending it out of the milky way ##. [CLS] [SEP] at its current speed it would make the journey from earth to the moon in just five minutes - a trip which took the apollo spacecraft three days ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for a video showing an artist ##' ##s impression of the event . [CLS] [SEP] astronomers in hawaii have found the fastest ' ##un ##bound ##' star in the galaxy ##. [CLS] [SEP] called us 70 ##8 it is moving at 74 ##5 miles ( ##1 ##, ##200 ##km ##) per second ##. [CLS] [SEP] it will leave the galaxy in about 25 million years ##. [CLS] [SEP] this artist ##' ##s concept shows a star ( ##le ##ft ##) being ejected from the galaxy ##, although in reality the super ##nova would have been faded long ago . [CLS] [SEP] the star ##, known as us 70 ##8 ##, was first discovered in 1982 by dr peter usher of pennsylvania state university but had since then remained ignored ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, a team of astronomers led by the university of hawaii at man ##oa has now re ##- ##ex ##amine ##d the star ##, and found that it breaks the galactic speed record for an ' ##un ##bound ##' star ##. [CLS] [SEP] us 70 ##8 is almost 62 ##, ##00 ##0 light ##- ##year ##s from earth ##, and is on a path that will take it out of the milky way in about 25 million years ##. [CLS] [SEP] type 1a ##: a white dwarf accumulate ##s material from a stellar companion until it undergoes runaway nuclear fusion and explodes ##. [CLS] [SEP] non ##- ##stand ##ard type 1a ##: two white dwarfs merge until their combined mass causes an explosion ##. [CLS] [SEP] type ii ##: a star at least nine times the mass of the sun eventually experiences a core collapse as its fuel runs out ##, causing it to explode ##. [CLS] [SEP] type 1b and 1 ##c ##: a star undergoes core collapse but most of its outer hydrogen has already been lost to stellar winds ##. [CLS] [SEP] hyper ##nova ##: extreme type of super ##nova ##, 50 times as energetic as other super ##nova ##s ##, resulting in a black hole ##. [CLS] [SEP] the exact cause of them is unknown ##. [CLS] [SEP] using the 10 ##- ##met ##re ke ##ck ii and pan ##- ##star ##rs ##1 telescopes in hawaii ##, the astronomers calculated that the star is moving at about 74 ##5 miles ( ##1 ##, ##200 ##km ##) per second ##. [CLS] [SEP] this makes it the fastest \ ##x ##e ##2 ##\

[CLS] [SEP] swiss researchers revealed that cha ##mel ##eon ##s use futuristic nano ##tech ##nology more advanced than anything humans possess to carry out their extraordinary colour changes ##. [CLS] [SEP] the reptiles are capable of rear ##rang ##ing crystals inside specialised skin cells to switch hue ##s in order to attract a potential mate or scare off a rival ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for video . [CLS] [SEP] swiss researchers have revealed that cha ##mel ##eon ##s ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##app ##ear to be capable of rear ##rang ##ing crystals inside specialised skin cells to switch hue ##s in order to attract a potential mate or scare off a rival ##. [CLS] [SEP] a stock image of a colourful panther cha ##mel ##eon is shown . [CLS] [SEP] the process involves the active tuning of a lattice of microscopic crystals in skin cells called ir ##ido ##ph ##ores ##. [CLS] [SEP] not only do the crystals allow the lizard to shift rapidly from efficient camouflage to spectacular mating displays ##, they also protect it from over ##hea ##ting ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was previously thought that coloured pigment ##s were gathered and dispersed inside different cells ##, allowing the animal to change hue ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] in studies of the panther cha ##mel ##eon ##, which comes from madagascar ##, scientists found that the creature actively controls the way its ir ##ido ##ph ##ore crystals generate colour ##. [CLS] [SEP] the reptiles appear to be capable of rear ##rang ##ing crystals inside specialised skin cells to switch hue ##s in order to attract a potential mate or scare off a rival ##. [CLS] [SEP] the process involves the active tuning of a lattice of microscopic crystals in skin cells called ir ##ido ##ph ##ores ##. [CLS] [SEP] italian researchers have discovered a way to convert the liquid state of extra virgin olive oil into a gel ##, without the need for other solids ##. [CLS] [SEP] variations include lemon and basil ##. [CLS] [SEP] olive oil ( ##pic ##ture ##d ##) has long been linked with lower levels of cho ##les ##terol ##, blood pressure and a multitude of other health benefits . [CLS] [SEP] the discovery was made by 10 chemical engineers from the italian university of calabria in the southern town of arc ##ava ##cat ##a ##. [CLS] [SEP] they used a technique called ' ##org ##ano ##gel ##azi ##one ##' which involves subject ##ing the properties of certain molecules known in the food industry ##, such as em ##uls ##ifiers ##, to a range of temperatures ##. [CLS] [SEP] when these molecules are heated and mixed they were found to form new structures ##. [CLS] [SEP] the university ##' ##s food engineering department headed by professor bruno de ci ##ndi ##o said ##: ' ##in this network structure ##, the oil remains ' ##tra ##pped ##' within the changing texture and transforms itself ##, in the first stage ##, into a gel form and ##, in a second stage ##, into a creamy spread ##able paste ##. ##' he added that said that this also means it can be produced in various consist ##encies from a slightly stick ##ier version ideal for dressing salad ##s and other foods to a more solid variation that can be spread like mar ##gar ##ine or butter on bread ##. [CLS] [SEP] the innovation has been patented and the team said it sees huge potential particularly among people with dietary restrictions or moral objections to dairy products such as vega ##ns ##. [CLS] [SEP] ph ##wo ##ar ##: ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##a study by the university of southampton says women prefer war heroes ##. [CLS] [SEP] they are also attracted to other heroic professions like being a fire ##man ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, men prefer women to not be in a heroic profession ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##on ##ly males seem to benefit from displaying heroism ##, ##' said dr le ##uni ##ssen from the university . [CLS] [SEP] the study was carried out by the university of southampton and published in the journal evolution and human behaviour ##. [CLS] [SEP] in the research 92 women studying in the uk were presented with hypothetical profiles of the opposite sex ##, representing varying levels of heroism in different contexts such as warfare ##, sport and business ##. [CLS] [SEP] they were then asked a series of questions designed to determine how attracted they were to the different profiles ##. [CLS] [SEP] women were more likely to find a soldier attractive ##, and were more inclined to date him ##, if he had been awarded a medal for bravery in combat ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers at the university of cambridge have discovered cut marks on 7 ##, ##00 ##0 year old human remains buried in a cave in pu ##glia ##, south eastern italy ##. [CLS] [SEP] these cuts and scrape ##s ##, made with stone tools ##, suggest the skeletons had their flesh carefully removed in rituals before being placed in the cave ##. [CLS] 540 ##, ##" ##all cigarettes in britain will be sold in plain packets bearing gr ##ues ##ome health warnings under a landmark new law backed by mps today ##. [CLS] [SEP] the legislation ##, which will come into force from may next year ##, easily cleared the commons by 36 ##7 votes to 113 ##. [CLS] [SEP] it follows the example of australia ##, which became the first country in the world to introduce the public health law two years ago to deter a new generation of young smoke ##rs ##. [CLS] [SEP] britain is to become the second country in the world to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes . [CLS] [SEP] powers to introduce standard ##ised packaging were in passed the children and families act 2014 ##, but mps must vote on bringing them into force ##. [CLS] [SEP] more than 100 mostly ##- ##tory mps opposed the move in a free vote this afternoon ##, but it passed into law with the support of labour and the li ##b dem ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] critics said the idea will not prevent people smoking ##, could confuse consumers and fuel illegal imports ##. [CLS] [SEP] but public health minister jane ellison insisted the plan would bring the country ' ##one step closer to our first smoke ##- ##free generation ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] she said she recognised concerns that standard ##ised packaging for cigarettes could be a ' ##sl ##ip ##per ##y slope ##' ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##tow ##ards a similar approach to other products such as junk food and alcohol ##. [CLS] [SEP] but she told mps ##: ' ##the government has no intention to extend standard ##ised packaging to any other product than tobacco ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##to ##ba ##cco is a uniquely harmful consumer good and as such it ##' ##s been treated uniquely in regulatory terms for many years ##. ##' ahead of the vote deborah ar ##not ##t ##, chief executive of health charity ash ##, said she was confident that mps will vote for the standard ##ised packaging ' ##by a large majority ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##thi ##s concept aims to help you see your own area or town from a different perspective ##. ##' the platform situated at the top of the lifting mechanism can be designed to the operator ##' ##s specifications . [CLS] [SEP] go ##etz sc ##hra ##der ##' ##s ' ##15 ##- ##min ##ute vacation ##s ##' are carried out on an extend ##able balcony that lifts visitors 30 ##ft into the air for an alternative view . [CLS] [SEP] within a few seconds the machine converts the familiar environment into a new experience for 15 minutes ##. [CLS] [SEP] the location is not fixed - but cities like london and new york are the target group since private space in those cities is limited and potential holiday spots can be far out of town ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##for just a short time ##, perhaps in your lunch break ##, you create a new and exciting situation by just shifting the perspective ##, ##' added mr sc ##hra ##der ##. [CLS] 70 ##5 ##, ##" ##a 3 ##, ##00 ##0 ##- ##year ##- ##old armenian settlement believed they could predict the future by using sheep and cow bones - and what they revealed on one occasion caused them to suddenly flee their homes ##. [CLS] [SEP] in a series of three bronze age shrines ##, archaeologists have found kn ##uck ##le ##bone ##s of animals with certain sides blackened - like the markings on dice - as well as stamp seals printed onto pieces of dough ##. [CLS] [SEP] experts believe the artefacts were used by divine ##rs to help leaders plan political strategies - but they were abandoned in place moments before the inhabitants fled the region ##. [CLS] [SEP] in three bronze age armenian shrines ##, archaeologists found kn ##uck ##le ##bone ##s of animals with certain sides blackened like the markings on dice as well as stamp seals printed onto pieces of dough ( ##pic ##ture ##d ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] the experts believe the artefacts were used by divine ##rs to help leaders plan political strategies . [CLS] [SEP] the reason for the sudden exodus remains unknown ##, but archaeologists believe the stones and bones suggested their demise was imminent ##. [CLS] [SEP] the bones were marked with burns and other engravings ##, and were small enough to roll ##. [CLS] [SEP] in one shrine ##, researchers found 18 pebbles ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##thes ##e stones appear to have been selected for their smooth ##, rounded shape and their colour palette ##, which ranged from black and dark grey to white ##, green and red ##, ##' wrote ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##pro ##fe ##sso ##r adam smith ##, lead author of the study at cornell university ##. [CLS] [SEP] the shrines were discovered in a hilltop fortress on the ts ##agh ##ka ##ho ##vi ##t plain of central armenia ##. [CLS] [SEP] lit ##hom ##ancy ##: a form of di ##vina ##tion by which the future is told using stones or reflected light from these stones ##. [CLS] [SEP] in modern practices 13 stones are cast and a prediction is made based on how they fall ##. [CLS] [SEP] os ##te ##oman ##cy ##: the use of bones for di ##vina ##tion ##, or os ##te ##oman ##cy ##, has been performed for thousands of years ##. [CLS] [SEP] in some cultures the bones were burned in a practice known as p ##yr ##o ##- ##ost ##eo ##man ##cy ##. [CLS] [SEP] ale ##uro ##man ##cy ##: this is the practice of baking messages inside cakes or cookies ##, which would then be distributed to those wishing their fortunes to be told ##. [CLS] [SEP] dice ##- ##like kn ##uck ##le ##bone ##s used for os ##te ##oman ##cy and coloured stones used for lit ##hom ##ancy were found deep within the ruins of the fallen citadel of ge ##gh ##aro ##t ##. [CLS] [SEP] fall ##: at first ##, the camera ##man thinks the animal is hut but soon realises the small rode ##nt is simply drunk . [CLS] [SEP] da ##unt ##ing ##: the drunk squirrel eyes up the challenge ahead - a small mound of snow between him and an open fence . [CLS] [SEP] his next great challenge is the small mound of snow between him and the open fence in an american backyard - a simple task made very difficult by his in ##eb ##riated state ##. [CLS] [SEP] several attempts to charge up the hill end in failure - leaving the res ##ili ##ent rode ##nt lying flat on his back gazing up at the branches he fell from earlier ##. [CLS] [SEP] he seems to have found a solution to his never ##- ##ending escape attempt when he targets a different region of the snow to the left - but several more attempts also end in failure ##. [CLS] [SEP] in a sober state ##, the squirrel may simply have strolled around the fence which ended just a few feet to the right ##. [CLS] [SEP] the shaky footage has gone viral since being uploaded to live leak and youtube where it has already gained tens of thousands of hits ##. [CLS] [SEP] after a few minutes of persistent climbing ##, the squirrel finally reaches the top of the tiny expanse of snow and rushes home - presumably to get some rest ##. [CLS] [SEP] persistent ##: the little animal continuously charges at the small mound of snow but always ends up flat on his back . [CLS] [SEP] escape ##: finally ##, after minutes of continuous jumping - much of it on the spot - it reaches the fence it could simply have walked around . [CLS] [SEP] freedom ##: with a similar lack of grace ##, the squirrel darts through the fence and up a slightly easier hill . [SEP]

[CLS] [SEP] there ##\ ##' ##s plenty of evidence that for many of them ##, the answer is no ##. [CLS] 86 ##2 ##, ##" ##ast ##ron ##ome ##rs have captured four images of the same exploding star nine billion light years away as it performed an incredible cosmic illusion ##. [CLS] [SEP] in doing so ##, they have confirmed an effect predicted by albert einstein ##' ##s general theory of relativity 100 years ago ##. [CLS] [SEP] the hub ##ble telescope snapped the surprising multiple images with the help of a galaxy cluster that acted as a natural mag ##ni ##fying lens ##. [CLS] [SEP] the powerful gravity of a galaxy embedded in a massive cluster of galaxies in this hub ##ble space telescope image is producing multiple images of a single distant super ##nova far behind it ##. [CLS] [SEP] both the galaxy and the galaxy cluster are acting like a giant cosmic lens ##, bending and mag ##ni ##fying light from the super ##nova behind them . [CLS] [SEP] the super ##nova could be seen because its light took different paths around the cluster located between the exploded star and the earth ##- ##or ##bit ##ing telescope ##. [CLS] [SEP] the cluster ##' ##s gravity causes passing photon ##s ##, or particles of light ##, to bend ##. [CLS] [SEP] gravitational lens ##ing occurs when galaxies and other objects amp ##li ##fy the light coming from other distant objects ##. [CLS] [SEP] it enables telescopes like hub ##ble to see objects that would otherwise be too faint and far away ##. [CLS] [SEP] this will combine the power of hub ##ble with the natural amp ##li ##fication caused by strong gravitational lens ##ing of distant galaxy clusters to study the past universe ##. [CLS] [SEP] einstein predicted this when explained how huge objects bend space ##- ##time to create what we experience as gravity ##. [CLS] [SEP] astronomers have been taking advantage of so ##- ##cal ##led ' ##gra ##vita ##tion ##al lens ##ing ##' to boost hub ##ble ##' ##s imaging powers and peer farther back in time ##. [CLS] [SEP] they say the latest images could help ref ##ine their estimates of the amount and distribution of dark matter in the lens ##ing galaxy ##. [CLS] [SEP] dark matter cannot be seen directly but is believed to make up most of the universe ##' ##s mass ##. [CLS] [SEP] by chance ##, the super ##nova ##, which exploded about nine billion years ago ##, was aligned with the intervening galaxy cluster being used during a hub ##ble observation period in 2011 ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists returned to the images in november to look for super ##nova ##e and found the quad ##rup ##le rendering - a configuration known as an einstein cross ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##the super ##nova team was looking at these image and bam ##, up popped not one ##, not two ##, not three ##, but four images ##, ##' said astronomer jennifer lot ##z ##, with the space telescope science institute in baltimore ##, maryland ##. [CLS] 90 ##1 ##, ##" ##a victoria cross awarded to private james towers ( ##pic ##ture ##d ##) after he demonstrated incredible bravery in the first world war is to be auction ##ed for \ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##31 ##60 ##, ##00 ##0 . [CLS] [SEP] a victoria cross medal awarded to a soldier who volunteered for a suicide mission during the first world war is to be auction ##ed for \ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##31 ##60 ##, ##00 ##0 ##. [CLS] [SEP] the honour ##, the highest decoration for val ##our in the face of the enemy ##, was awarded to private james towers after he brave ##ly volunteered for the mission at mer ##ico ##urt near lens ##, france ##, on october 6 ##, 1918 ##. [CLS] [SEP] the soldier ##, from preston ##, lancashire ##, stepped forward as the sixth man to dash out in front of enemy machine gun posts and get a vital message to a cut ##- ##off platoon 150 yards in front of him ##. [CLS] [SEP] he put himself forward despite witnessing the five previous runners - including his best friend private frank dunlop - get shot down just minutes earlier ##. [CLS] [SEP] during his mission ##, he managed to evade bullets and even startled a german machine gun nest when he leapt across an embankment and landed just five feet away from them ##. [CLS] [SEP] they were so surprised they failed to launch bullets until after he had fled ##. [CLS] [SEP] the sold ##er eventually made it to the lost platoon ##, gave the orders to the commanding officer and dug in with them for the night ##. [CLS] [SEP] using his knowledge of the location of the german machine gun posts ##, he led them safely back to the british lines at dawn the next day ##. [CLS] [SEP] for his incredible act of courage ##, he was awarded the victoria cross and it was presented to him by king george v at buckingham palace upon his return to britain ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was left to his family when he died ##, aged 79 ##, in 1977 ##, and later sold at auction in 1983 ##. [CLS] [SEP] it has been owned by a private collector for the last 30 years but is now going to be sold on again at an auction in london later this month ##. [CLS] [SEP] as well as the victoria cross ##, four other medals of his will also be auction ##ed including his ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##bri ##tish war and victory medals ##, his coronation 1937 medal and his coronation 1953 honour ##. [CLS] [SEP] rise of hispanic america ##: hispanic ##s are becoming the nation ##' ##s largest minority but in ##e ##qual ##ities between whites and hispanic ##s still exist . [CLS] [SEP] the immigration and natural ##ization act of 1965 abolished the quota system based on national origin ##. [CLS] [SEP] national quota ##s limited the number of people who were allowed im ##mi ##grate from other countries ##. [CLS] [SEP] thanks to the civil rights movement ##, the immigration policy shifted and became focused on re ##uni ##ting immigrant families and attracting new labor to the united states ##. [CLS] [SEP] for nearly two centuries and up until the time ronald reagan was president ##, white european immigrants made up to 80 per cent of the us population ##. [CLS] [SEP] now less than two thirds of the population are white and whites will be a minority by 204 ##4 ##, says census bureau ##. [CLS] [SEP] since 2000 ##, the population of the united states has grown by slightly over 40 million people ##. [CLS] [SEP] thirty five million , or 90 percent ##, of that growth is from minorities - hispanic ##s ##, asian americans and african americans ##, says a report published by ##bus ##iness wire ##. [CLS] 950 ##, ##" ##t ##wo underground craters measuring 400 ##km together in size have been discovered in central australia ##, spark ##ing the possibility of a previously unknown asteroid impact event 300 million years ago that caused many species to go extinct ##. [CLS] [SEP] the impact zone was found in the war ##bu ##rton basin in two parts ##, each 200 ##km wide ##, indicating the meteor that created them split into two before smashing into the earth ##. [CLS] [SEP] even though it was found two kilometres underground ##, the impact zone is now the largest in the world ##, by over 100 ##km ##. [CLS] [SEP] dr andrew g ##lik ##son from an ##u indicates that the size of the asteroid means it could have impacted a mass extinction . [CLS] [SEP] the precise age of the crater is not yet known exactly ##, but researchers think it may be around 300 million years ##. [CLS] [SEP] \ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##8 ##we cannot define this impact zone in anywhere near the degree of detail we can define the ones exposed on the surface ##, ##' lead researcher dr andrew g ##lik ##son of the australian national university ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##xa ##0 ##to ##ld daily mail australia ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers strongly believe the meteor could have caused the end of many life species on the planet at the time ##, including the dinosaurs ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##fr ##om the size - yes ##, it could have impacted a mass extinction ##, ##' dr g ##lik ##son said ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##eve ##n though we do not know the exact age of the meteor yet ##, we do know life was very primitive at that time ##. ##' the impact zone extends through the earth ##' ##s crust which is around 30 ##km thick in central australia ##. [CLS] [SEP] the two adjoining craters were thought to have been caused when a meteor split on its approach to earth ##, forming two smaller ones each about 10 ##km across ##. [CLS] [SEP] this impact zone ##, if confirmed ##, would be the largest in the world ##. [CLS] [SEP] the second largest is the vr ##ede ##fort crater in south australia ##, spanning 300 ##km ##. [CLS] [SEP] this zone survives on the surface of earth and therefore is easier to find than those underground ##. [CLS] [SEP] the impact zone was flag ##ged after rock affected by heat and pressure was turned into glass . [CLS] [SEP] the impact zone was flag ##ged after rock affected by heat and pressure ##, consequently being turned into glass was discovered ##, also known as shock meta ##morphism ##. [CLS] [SEP] the features of this meta ##morphism show that material was dramatically thrown out of the area in a span of more than 200 ##km ##, indicating the possibility of a mass extinction ##. [CLS] [SEP] spanish astronomers have revealed a new theory for a \ ##' ##y ##\ ##' shape on venus ( ##ann ##ota ##ted image from the pioneer venus orbit ##er in 1979 shown ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] they say it is formed by winds pushing a \ ##' ##wave ##\ ##' of clouds on the planet ##. [CLS] [SEP] these winds move faster at higher altitudes ##, creating the odd shape . [CLS] [SEP] the latest theory was proposed by astronomers from the institute of astro ##physics of and ##al ##usia ( ##ia ##a ##- ##cs ##ic ##) in granada ##, spain ##, in collaboration with the university of the basque country and the institute of astro ##physics and space sciences of portugal ##. [CLS] [SEP] venus is slightly smaller than earth but has a similar mass ##. [CLS] [SEP] it is the second closest planet to the sun at a distance of about 67 million miles ( ##10 ##8 million kilometres ##) ##, and takes about 225 days to orbit the sun ##. [CLS] [SEP] one day on venus lasts as long as 243 earth days ##. [CLS] [SEP] its thick and toxic atmosphere is made up mostly of carbon dioxide and nitrogen ##, with clouds of sul ##ph ##uri ##c acid droplets ##. [CLS] [SEP] it ##\ ##' ##s believed that its atmosphere contributed to a runaway greenhouse effect that made the planet in ##hos ##pit ##able ##. [CLS] [SEP] the planet ##\ ##' ##s extreme high temperatures of almost 480 ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##x ##b ##0 ##c ( ##90 ##0 ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##x ##b ##0 ##f ##) make it seem an unlikely place for for life as we know it ##. [CLS] [SEP] on venus strong winds move the upper atmosphere 225 mph ( ##36 ##0 ##km ##/ ##h ##) ##, circling the planet every four to five earth days ##. [CLS] [SEP] but the planet itself takes almost 243 earth days to complete an orbit - meaning the winds are much faster than the rotation speed of the planet ##. [CLS] [SEP] the winds have a mostly constant speed at different latitude

[CLS] 98 ##6 ##, ##" ##sc ##ient ##ists have discovered that there might be dark matter trapped inside the sun - and it could be the solar interior ##. [CLS] [SEP] the bold new theory suggests that a form of the mysterious particle - which has yet to be directly observed - is absorbed by the sun from the centre of our galaxy ##. [CLS] [SEP] and once inside ##, it affects the movement of heat within our solar system ##' ##s star - which could explain why scientists have struggled to explain ' ##press ##ure waves ##' inside the sun ##. [CLS] [SEP] durham university scientists have proposed a new model for the sun ##. [CLS] [SEP] they say that dark matter may be transferring heat around its interior ( ##art ##ist ##' ##s illustration shown ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] this would help explain how pressure waves move around the sun ##. [CLS] [SEP] current models are insufficient to account for how they move . [CLS] [SEP] the theory was put forward by scientists from durham university ##. [CLS] [SEP] they propose that so ##- ##cal ##led as ##ym ##metric dark matter ( ##ad ##m ##) could explain some inc ##ons ##iste ##ncies in the standard solar model ##. [CLS] [SEP] so far ##, the standard solar model has proved successful in calculating the sun ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 ##s density and temperature - but measuring ' ##press ##ure waves ##' in its interior has proved much more difficult ##. [CLS] [SEP] the sun is about 15 million kelvin in temperature at its core ##, and 6 ##, ##00 ##0 kelvin at its surface ##. [CLS] [SEP] when physicist ##s study the dynamics of galaxies and the movement of stars ##, they are confronted with a mystery ##. [CLS] [SEP] if they only take visible matter into account ##, their equations simply don ##' ##t add up ##; the elements that can be observed are not sufficient to explain the rotation of objects and the existing gravitational forces ##. [CLS] [SEP] there is something missing ##. [CLS] [SEP] from this they de ##duced that there must be an invisible kind of matter that does not interact with light but does ##, as a whole ##, interact by means of the gravitational force ##. [CLS] [SEP] called ' ##dar ##k matter ##' ##, this substance appears to make up at least 80 per cent of the matter in the known universe ##. [CLS] [SEP] pressure waves are produced as a result of activity on the solar surface ##. [CLS] [SEP] they are not entirely di ##ssi ##mi ##lar to pressure waves - or p - ##wave ##s - produced on earth during an earthquake ##. [CLS] [SEP] it has previously been theo ##rise ##d that dark matter originating from elsewhere in the galaxy may have an affect on the sun - particularly its activity and even its structure ##. [CLS] [SEP] its presence has potentially been spotted in a dwarf matter orbiting the milky way which is radiating gamma rays - the most powerful form of radioactive waves known in the universe ##. [CLS] [SEP] how these mysterious waves are made ##, and where exactly they come from have baffled scientists for years ##, but scientists believe they are a sign for dark matter ##. [CLS] [SEP] scroll down for video . [CLS] [SEP] scientists at brown ##, carnegie mellon ##, and cambridge universities have detected gamma ray emissions from the direction of the galaxy re ##tic ##ulum 2 ##. [CLS] [SEP] bright areas indicate a strong gamma ray signal coming from the direction of the galaxy ##, according to the researchers ##\ ##x ##e ##2 ##\ ##x ##80 ##\ ##x ##9 ##9 search algorithm . [CLS] [SEP] dark matter is the missing substance that makes up to 80 per cent of the universe ##' ##s mass ##. [CLS] [SEP] it has been described as ' ##the most important un ##sol ##ved problems in modern physics ##. ##' when physicist ##s study the dynamics of galaxies and the movement of stars ##, they are confronted with a mystery ##. [CLS] [SEP] if they only take visible matter into account ##, their equations simply don ##' ##t add up ##; the elements that can be observed are not sufficient to explain the rotation of objects and the existing gravitational forces ##. [CLS] [SEP] there is something missing ##. [CLS] [SEP] from this they de ##duced that there must be an invisible kind of matter that does not interact with light but does ##, as a whole ##, interact by means of the gravitational force ##. [CLS] [SEP] called ' ##dar ##k matter ##' ##, this substance appears to make up at least 80 per cent of the matter in the known universe ##. [CLS] [SEP] the galaxy ##, named re ##tic ##ulum 2 ##, was discovered within the past few weeks in the data of the dark energy survey ##. [CLS] [SEP] at 98 ##, ##00 ##0 light ##- ##year ##s from earth ##, re ##tic ##ulum 2 is one of the nearest dwarf galaxies yet detected . [CLS] [SEP] according to physicist ##s at carnegie mellon ##, brown and cambridge universities ##, gamma rays coming from the direction of the galaxy are in excess of what would be expected from normal background ##. [CLS] 102 ##0 ##, ##" ##com ##mon sense would suggest that when molten lava meets a sheet of ice it will simply melt through ##. [CLS] [SEP] but geologist professor jeff ka ##rson and artist professor bob w ##ys ##ock ##i from syracuse university in new york found that the results can be far more spectacular ##. [CLS] [SEP] using a lava furnace to heat gravel to temperatures of more than 1 ##, ##100 ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##x ##b ##0 ##c ( ##2 ##, ##00 ##0 ##\ ##x ##c ##2 ##\ ##x ##b ##0 ##f ##) they were able to pour it onto a slab of ice to produce a see ##thing ##, bubbling mass of molten rock ##. [CLS] [SEP] lava turns ice directly into steam which bubbles up through the molten rock to form bizarre glass bubbles . [CLS] [SEP] professor ka ##rson ##, who has been pouring lava in a series of experiments to better understand how it behave ##s and forms geological formations ##, described it as ' ##sc ##ram ##bled eggs from hell ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] rather than melting straight through the ice ##, the lava instead flows rapidly on top of it on a cushion of steam ##. [CLS] [SEP] steam from the ice below bubbles up through the molten rock as it tries to escape ##, forming a layer of glass ##y bubbles ##. [CLS] [SEP] professor ka ##rson said ##: ' ##the first guess is that it is going to explode or it is tunnel down and make a hole in the ice ##. [CLS] [SEP] of course it didn ##' ##t do any of those things ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##it did things we just didn ##' ##t really expect ##. ##' professor ka ##rson and professor w ##ys ##ock ##i have together set up the lava project at syracuse university ##' ##s department of earth sciences to study how lava behave ##s in different situations ##. [CLS] [SEP] they create lava by melting basalt gravel in a giant gas fired furnace and then pouring it over sand ##, ice and through water ##. [CLS] [SEP] according to alistair lin ##sell ##, a nuclear chemist working with ed ##f energy and a science presenter with the science channel ##, the extreme heat of the lava is what causes the strange formations to form when it hits the ice ##. [CLS] [SEP] he said ##: ' ##the lava is so hot that when it is poured on to the ice ##, the ice turns not into water but straight into steam ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##the formation of all of this steam helps the lava to flow ##. [CLS] [SEP] it is sitting on top of a blanket of steam rather than the ice itself ##, this means the friction between the lava and the ice surface is very low ##. [CLS] [SEP] the lava flows rapidly across the surface of the ice on a cushion of escaping steam

[CLS] [SEP] the scientists found nitrate ##s - a source of nitrogen for life on earth ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was likely created by asteroid impacts or lightning in volcanic plume ##s . [CLS] 110 ##3 ##, ##" ##( ##c ##nn ##) ##w ##hen chinese photographer wang wen ##lan first pressed the shutter on a borrowed soviet camera in 1967 ##, he was a teenager taking photos to kill time during chairman mao ze ##dong ##\ ##' ##s cultural revolution ##. [CLS] [SEP] " ##" ##i made rolls of film out of a motion ##- ##pic ##ture reel i found ##. [CLS] [SEP] the photographic paper was left over from printing mao ##\ ##' ##s portraits ##, ##" ##" wang told cnn ##. [CLS] [SEP] five decades later ##, wang ##, 61 ##, is one of the country ##\ ##' ##s top photo ##jou ##rna ##lists ##. [CLS] [SEP] his work is a rich chronicle of china ##\ ##' ##s fast ##- ##chang ##ing society ##. [CLS] [SEP] " ##" ##sti ##ll images are fragments ##, sections and points that connect the history ##, ##" ##" wang says ##. [CLS] [SEP] " ##" ##the whole process of china ##\ ##' ##s reform over the past four decades - ##- whether going forward or stall ##ing - ##- i ##\ ##' ##ve been determined to and have managed to document it all ##. ##" ##" one of his most famous series of photographs tracks china ##\ ##' ##s relationship with the bicycle - ##- once a family ##\ ##' ##s most precious asset but now fast vanishing from the streets ##. [CLS] [SEP] photography was an outlet for wang during the dark days of the cultural revolution ##, when china was con ##vu ##ls ##ed by violent class struggle ##. [CLS] [SEP] his family were labeled " ##" ##cap ##ital ##ist road ##ers ##" ##" and unlike most other kids ##, he couldn ##\ ##' ##t join the red guards ##. [CLS] [SEP] des ##pon ##dent ##, 14 ##- ##year ##- ##old wang wandered around beijing with friends in similar situations ##, snapping pictures and portraits to distract himself ##. [CLS] [SEP] taking photos turned into more than a past ##ime in january 1976 ##, when premier zhou en ##lai died - beloved by many for his role in temper ##ing the worst of mao ##\ ##' ##s excess ##es ##. [CLS] [SEP] wang went to tian ##an ##men square with his camera ##, capturing the un ##pro ##mpt ##ed out ##pour ##ing of grief ##, both then ##, and again in april that year ##. [CLS] [SEP] " ##" ##i was in deep grief ##, ##" ##" wang said ##, " ##" ##and i felt i should record the collective grief ##. ##" ##" he kept the film secret from the military ##, which then employed him as a photographer ##, transferring it to friends ##. [CLS] [SEP] the photos were published in the early 1980s ##. [CLS] [SEP] from then on ##, wang saw that his camera was much more than a memory keeper ##. [CLS] [SEP] a group of over 20 kangaroo ##s have made a quick dash across the craig ##ie ##burn east road in victoria on thursday morning ##. [CLS] [SEP] the swarm executed perfect timing with the cars able to safely slow down and watch the group . [CLS] [SEP] the video shows the troop hopping across the busy road in single file and jumping over a barbed ##- ##wire fence to make it to the land on the other side ##. [CLS] [SEP] all caught on a driver ##' ##s dash cam ##, some of the animals are seen to be doing flip ##s over the fence and disappearing into the long grass ##. [CLS] [SEP] luckily all other cars slow to a halt on the 100 ##km ##/ ##hr road to wait for the group to safely cross ##, with all cautiously driving off after the encounter ##. [CLS] [SEP] with no clear ' ##kan ##gar ##oo crossing ##' signage the confrontation could have been potentially dangerous ##. [CLS] [SEP] kangaroo crossings are more dangerous at night as the animals become blinded by vehicle head lights . [CLS] [SEP] some of the kangaroo ##s can be seen performing expert flip ##s over the barbed wire fence and disappear into the grass . [CLS] [SEP] the crossing took place at 10 ##. ##50 am on a thursday and there were clearly not too many vehicles on the usually busy road ##. [CLS] [SEP] the craig ##ie ##burn east road is 45 minutes north of melbourne and the driver was on his way to work ##. [CLS] [SEP] in the day ##, our hopping friends are more likely to make a safer crossing by choosing their moments to dash more wise ##ly ##. [CLS] [SEP] however in the evenings ##, when they are most active ##, they are easily collected as they become blinded by the headlights of cars ##. [SEP]

[CLS] [SEP] the findings will add to mounting evidence that ne ##ander ##thal ##s were not the slow ##- ##wi ##tted and prima ##tive creatures they are often portrayed as ##. [CLS] [SEP] instead they are emerging as having had a sophisticated culture ##, were highly intelligent and may have even created art ##. [CLS] [SEP] it has been around 30 ##, ##00 ##0 years since the ancestors of modern ##- ##day humans are thought to have wiped out the ancient ne ##ander ##thal ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] but the extinct species could be taking revenge on us from beyond the grave by making us more vulnerable to potentially killer diseases such as cancer and diabetes ##. [CLS] [SEP] ne ##ander ##thal ##s and modern humans are thought to have co ##- ##ex ##iste ##d for thousands of years and inter ##bre ##d ##, meaning europeans now have roughly 2 per cent ne ##ander ##thal dna ##. [CLS] [SEP] these ' ##leg ##acy ##' genes have been linked to an increased risk from cancer and diabetes by new studies looking at our evolutionary history ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, some genes we inherited could have also improved our immunity to other diseases ##. [CLS] [SEP] scientists have found that part of our h ##la system ##, which helps white blood cells to identify and destroy foreign material in the body ##, could have come from ne ##ander ##thal ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] other researchers have suggested that humans outside africa are more vulnerable to type 2 diabetes because they inter ##bre ##d with ne ##ander ##thal ##s ##. [CLS] [SEP] researchers from oxford and plymouth universities have also found that genes thought to be risk factors in cancer were present in the ne ##ander ##thal genome ##. [CLS] [SEP] a gene that can cause diabetes in latin americans is also thought to have come from ne ##ander ##thal ##s ##, long before their ancestors colon ##ised the new world ##. [CLS] [SEP] the new findings suggest that the talon ##s may have had a symbolic purpose - something that some anthropologist ##s have argued ne

[CLS] [SEP] the aw ##wa ##- ##q ##g progress eagle was dreamed up by barcelona ##- ##base ##d designer oscar vi ##\ ##x ##c ##3 ##\ ##x ##b ##1 ##als as part of his vision for how travelling by air could be in 203 ##0 ##. [CLS] [SEP] capacity ##: 800 passengers . [CLS] [SEP] wingspan ##: 96 ##m . [CLS] [SEP] length ##: 80 ##m . [CLS] [SEP] decks ##: 3 . [CLS] [SEP] engines ##: five super ##con ##ductive engines . [CLS] [SEP] anne frank ( ##pic ##ture ##d ##) likely died of ty ##phus inside the bergen ##- ##bel ##sen concentration camp in mid february 1945 ##, a study has shown ##, not on march 31 as previously thought . [CLS] [SEP] anne ##' ##s diary ##, which documents how her family went into hiding from the nazis in the netherlands during the second world war ##, became a bestseller when it was published after then end of the war ##. [CLS] [SEP] the book documents how anne ##, her sister margot and her family went into hiding in a canal house ##, but were eventually betrayed and sent to bergen ##- ##bel ##sen ##, where she and her sister perished ##. [CLS] [SEP] anne frank wrote her diary while in hiding from nazi persecution during world war ii ##. [CLS] [SEP] by 1940 the nazis had occupied the netherlands ##, leaving the family trapped ##. [CLS] [SEP] in 1942 the family went into hiding in secret rooms of otto frank ##' ##s office building ##. [CLS] [SEP] but after two years the group were anonymous ##ly betrayed and were sent to their deaths at the bergen ##- ##bel ##sen concentration camp ##, where anne died of ty ##phus in 1945 ##. [CLS] [SEP] otto frank ##, anne ##' ##s father ##, returned to amsterdam after the war and discovered her diary had been saved ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was published in 1947 ##, leading to her posthumous fame ##. [CLS] [SEP] after the war the dutch government set the official date of her death as march 31 ##, based on survivors accounts stating that the girls died sometime in march ##. [CLS] [SEP] because the allies liberated the camp on april 15 ##, this added a bitter twist to her tale - the thought that if she could have hung on a few weeks longer she might have been saved ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, erika pri ##ns ##, a researcher at the anne frank house museum ##, has now revised that date having studied witness accounts ##, archives ##, and conducted at least one new interview ##. [CLS] [SEP] ms pri ##ns said she now believes that anne and her sister began exhibiting symptoms of ty ##phus at

[CLS] 127 ##0 ##, ##" ##a new online cal ##cula ##tor aims to predict the age at which a person is likely to suffer a heart attack or stroke ##. [CLS] [SEP] the tool compares a person ##' ##s actual age with their heart age ##, after considering simple lifestyle information ##, including height and weight ##. [CLS] [SEP] while those behind the new test argue it is designed to arm people with the knowledge they need to make changes to improve their lifestyle ##s ##, critics have questioned how effective it will be ##. [CLS] [SEP] gps will be encouraged to tell patients about the test ##, to help em ##power them to live health ##ier lives ##. [CLS] [SEP] but one expert warned the test may scare people into taking medication ##, including stat ##ins ##, to lower their cho ##les ##terol ##. [CLS] [SEP] click here to take the test . [CLS] [SEP] the nhs heart age cal ##cula ##tor test predict ##s a person ##' ##s heart age as well as the age at which they are likely to suffer a heart attack or stroke . [CLS] [SEP] as well as predicting how long a person can expect to live before suffering a heart attack or stroke ##, the cal ##cula ##tor offers a free nhs health check ##, giving advice on how to enjoy a health ##ier lifestyle . [CLS] [SEP] the test asks people to enter basic details ##, including their age ##, height and weight and post ##code ##. [CLS] [SEP] whether a person smoke ##s ##, if they are dia ##bet ##ic ##, suffering r ##he ##uma ##to ##id arthritis ##, chronic kidney failure or at ##rial fi ##bri ##llation - an irregular heartbeat - is considered ##. [CLS] [SEP] finally ##, it asks if a person has a family history of cardiovascular disease in relatives under the age of 60 ##. [CLS] [SEP] using the information ##, the cal ##cula ##tor generates a heart age ##, as well as predicting how long a person can expect to live before they are likely to suffer a heart attack or stroke ##. [CLS] [SEP] it was the biggest eruption of the year and peaked at 4 ##. ##22 ##pm gm ##t yesterday ( ##sho ##wn ##) this flare was classified as an x ##2 ##. ##2 ##- ##class flare ##. [CLS] [SEP] x ##- ##class denotes the most intense flare ##s ##, while the number provides more information about its strength ##. [CLS] [SEP] an x ##2 is twice as intense as an x ##1 ##, an x ##3 is three times as intense ##, and so on ##. [CLS] [SEP] solar flare ##s are powerful bursts of radiation ##, but harmful radiation from a flare cannot pass through earth ##' ##s atmosphere to physically affect humans on the ground ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, when intense enough ##, they can disturb the atmosphere in the layer where gps and communications signals travel ##. [CLS] [SEP] this flare was emitted from active region 122 ##9 ##7 ( ##ar ##12 ##29 ##7 ##) on the sun ##. [CLS] [SEP] the say a steady dustin ##g of carbon from passing comets has slowly painted mercury black over billions of years ##. [CLS] [SEP] it solve ##s the mystery of mercury ##' ##s unusual colour ##ing - which has baffled scientists ##. [CLS] [SEP] the say a steady dustin ##g of carbon from passing comets has slowly painted mercury with a dark ' ##ste ##al ##th ##' coating over billions of years ##. [CLS] [SEP] comet ##ary dust is composed of as much as 25 percent carbon by weight ##, so mercury would be exposed to a steady bombardment of carbon from these crumbling comets ##. [CLS] [SEP] using a model of impact delivery and a known estimate of micro ##met ##eo ##rite flux at mercury ##, researchers calculated suggest that after billions of years of bombardment ##, mercury ##' ##s surface should be anywhere from 3 to 6 percent carbon ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##it ##' ##s long been h ##yp ##oth ##es ##ized that there ##' ##s a mystery darkening agent that ##' ##s contributing to mercury ##' ##s low reflect ##ance ##, ##' said megan br ##uck sy ##al ##, a postdoctoral researcher at lawrence liver ##more national laboratory who performed this research while a graduate student at brown university ##. [CLS] [SEP] ' ##one thing that hadn ##' ##t been considered was that mercury gets dumped on by a lot of material derived from comets ##. ##' on average ##, mercury is much darker than its closest air ##less neighbour ##, our moon ##. [CLS] [SEP] air ##less bodies are known to be darkened by micro ##met ##eo ##rite impacts and bombardment of solar wind ##, processes that create a thin coating of dark iron nano ##par ##tic ##les on the surface ##. [CLS] [SEP] but spectral data from mercury suggests its surface contains very little nano ##pha ##se iron ##, certainly not enough to account for its dim appearance ##. [CLS] [SEP] as comets approach mercury ##' ##s neighborhood near the sun ##, they often start to break apart ##. [CLS] [SEP] comet ##ary dust is composed of as much as 25 percent carbon by weight ##, so mercury would be exposed to a steady bombardment of carbon from these crumbling comets ##. [CLS] [SEP] using a model of impact delivery and a known estimate of micro ##met ##eo ##rite flux at mercury ##, br ##uck sy ##al was able to estimate how often comet ##ary material would impact mercury ##, how much carbon would stick to mercury ##' ##s surface ##, and how much would be thrown back into space ##. [CLS] [SEP] her calculations suggest that after billions of years of bombardment ##, mercury ##' ##s surface should be anywhere from 3 to 6 percent carbon ##. [CLS] 138 ##1 ##, ##" ##the human eye is opt ##imi ##sed to have good colour vision at day and high sensitivity at night ##. [CLS] [SEP] but until recently it seemed as if the cells in the re ##tina were wired the wrong way round ##, with light travelling through a mass of neurons before it reaches the light ##- ##de ##tec ##ting rod and cone cells ##. [CLS] [SEP] new research presented at a meeting of the american physical society has uncovered a remarkable vision ##- ##en ##han ##cing function for this pu ##zzling structure ##. [CLS] [SEP] israel institute of technology researchers studied human re ##tina ##s ( ##ima ##ge of an eye interior shown ##) ##. [CLS] [SEP] they looked at why cells in our re ##tina ##s are wired the wrong way round ##. [CLS] [SEP] light travels through a mass of neurons before it reaches the ' ##back ##' ##. [CLS] [SEP] the research suggests the structure appears to enhance our vision . [CLS] [SEP] about a century ago ##, the fine structure of the re ##tina was discovered ##. [CLS] [SEP] the re ##tina is the light ##- ##sen ##sit ##ive part of the eye ##, lining the inside of the eye ##ball ##. [CLS] [SEP] the back of the re ##tina contains cones to sense the colours red ##, green and blue ##. [CLS] [SEP] spread among the cones are rods ##, which are much more light ##- ##sen ##sit ##ive than cones ##, but which are colour ##- ##bl ##ind ##. [CLS] [SEP] before arriving at the cones and rods ##, light must traverse the full thickness of the re ##tina ##, with its layers of neurons and cell nuclei ##. [CLS] [SEP] these neurons process the image information and transmit it to the brain ##, but until recently it has not been clear why these cells lie in front of the cones and rods ##, not behind them ##. [CLS] [SEP] the human eye can see more that we thought ##, researchers said in december ##. [CLS] [SEP] it had previously been believed the human eye cannot see infrared light ##, in the same way we can ##' ##t see x ##- ##ray ##s and radio waves ##. [CLS] [SEP] however ##, researchers have revealed that under certain conditions ##, the re ##tina can sense infrared light after all ##. [CLS] [SEP] an international team of researchers co ##- ##led by scientists at washington university school of medicine in st ##. [CLS] [SEP] louis used cells from the re ##tina ##s of mice and people ##. [CLS] [SEP] by firing powerful lasers that emi ##t pulses of infrared light ##, the researchers found that when laser light pulses rapidly ##, light ##- ##sen ##sing cells in the re ##tina sometimes get a double hit of infrared energy ##. [CLS] [SEP] when that happens ##, the eye is able to detect light that falls outside the visible spectrum ##. [CLS] [SEP]

[CLS] [SEP] although the animals would be introduced onto privately owned estates ##, the woodland would be un ##fen ##ced ##, meaning the 70 ##lb animals could roam free around the countryside ##. [CLS] [SEP] lynx could be introduced into the uk countryside for the first time in 1 ##, ##30 ##0 years ##, it emerged yesterday . [CLS] [SEP] scientists argue that introducing lynx will benefit the ecosystem ##, by helping control the 1 ##mill ##ion uk deer population ##, as well as boost ##ing the tourist economy ##. [CLS] [SEP] but the move is controversial and likely to be opposed by farmers worried about the animals sava ##ging their livestock and game birds ##. [CLS] [SEP] under the plan ##, devised by the lynx trust ##, four to six cats would be released at each site ##. [CLS] [SEP] around the size of a large dog and with powerful claws for climbing ##, they will be released into areas rich in deer and trees and each will wear a tracking device so their movements can be monitored ##.
